summary: The bill, titled the "Restoring the VA Home Loan Program in Perpetuity Act of 2025," aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code concerning veterans' home loans. It places limitations on the Secretary of Veterans Affairs' authority to purchase certain defaulted loans guaranteed by the Department of Veterans Affairs, restricting the number of such loans purchased in a fiscal year. Additionally, it mandates a report to Congress outlining a plan to sell these acquired loans to non-governmental entities.
